intro: Serratula tuberosa, commonly known as the meadow thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a cluster. Serratula tuberosa is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
